findings.title: Hardcoded API Key in Source Code
findings.description: A hardcoded API key was found in the application source code, which could be extracted by reverse engineering.
findings.remediation: Store API keys in the Android Keystore or retrieve them from a secure backend at runtime.

findings.title: Insecure Data Storage - Shared Preferences
findings.description: Sensitive user credentials are stored in SharedPreferences without encryption.
findings.remediation: Use EncryptedSharedPreferences or the Android Keystore to protect sensitive data at rest.

findings.title: Certificate Pinning Not Implemented
findings.description: The application does not implement certificate pinning, making it vulnerable to MITM attacks.
findings.remediation: Implement certificate pinning using OkHttp CertificatePinner or network_security_config.xml.

findings.title: Debug Mode Enabled in Release Build
findings.description: The application has android:debuggable=true in the release manifest.
findings.remediation: Set android:debuggable to false in release builds.

findings.title: Weak Encryption Algorithm Used
findings.description: The application uses DES encryption which is considered weak.
findings.remediation: Replace DES with AES-256-GCM for symmetric encryption.
